p: Evidence of virus growth is seen through the cytopathic effect (CPE) exhibiting specific characteristics and alterations of the cells ( Robbins, Enders and Weller, 1950). The virus definitive identification is then performed using Immunofluorescence (IF) staining. Nevertheless, virus isolation using cell culture is not ideal in case of viruses not amenable to growth in cell lines (norovirus, hepatitis virus) or producing CPE ( Papafragkou et al., 2013 ).
